page.title: 03Rhuddlan
page.content: A month after Edward 1 had landed at Flint, he moved on to Rhuddlan, near the mouth of the River Clwyd. Rhuddlan was an old{Norman town}and he decided to build a{castle}and new planned town. Rhuddlan is a very{historic } village and was until the last century the major town of the area. Today Rhuddlan is a small, very pleasant village. The ruins of the castle of Rhuddlan still stand today and many {tourists}visit the castle each year. Rhuddlan Village also takes most of the holiday traffic to Rhyl and suffers long{traffic jams}during the peak season along its narrow High Street.
